This Ugandan Woman Has 44 Children & Now The Government Has Ordered Her Not To Have More Kids

The job of a parent is quite exhausting. You ask yourself thousands of questions before planning to have a baby. Well, just think about this Ugandan woman who had 44 children by the time she turned 36.

Mariam Nabatanzi was married to a man who was 28 years older to her when she was 12. She had her first set of children who were twins, a year later. Three years later, she was abandoned by her husband and she had to take care of 38 children they had together.

PA

But that is not normal, right? Mariam thought so and went to see a doctor after her first pregnancy, who told her that she had unusual large ovaries and taking contraceptives - like pills to control birth - could result in health complications.

However, after the birth of 44 kids, she has now been ordered to stop having children and doctors has even stepped in to remove her uterus, according to the Courier Mail. Mariam had a traumatic childhood and she doesn’t want the same fate for her children, she wants to give them the best.

She has worked odd jobs just to provide everything her children needed. She has to do a lot to feed them - she says that on an average her family consumes 25 kg flour. Her eldest son had to drop out from the school to help out his mother.

PA

He said, "Mum is overwhelmed, the work is crushing her, we help where we can, like in cooking and washing, but she still carries the whole burden for the family. I feel for her."

Having such a difficult childhood, a mother would never want her children to face the same trauma.
